Primary_Text: со̄нн пӯдтӭ моа̄ст, ме̄гк я тэнн кӯдт альк поҏт
Analyzed: soːnː puːdʲ-e mɒːst mʲeːgː ja tənː kudː alʲk por̥-t
Gloss: 3SG.NOM come‑PST.3SG back sell.PRS.1SG and this.ACC.SG six.ACC son.GEN.SG eat‑CAUS.PRS.3SG
Translation: He went back home, sells (material), and feeds those six sons
In winter, the sun rarely appears

Analyzed: tunː ɨgʲ-esʲtʲ mun kaːnʲːʦʲ poːdː-əɫ mənʲː-e tɒːjːw
Translation: Last year my friend often came to see me

Analyzed: munː lʲiːjː-e lɨhk-mʲenʲ laːfʲkʲ-esʲtʲ kuesʲː jɒdː-əj abʲːrʲ
Gloss: 1SG.NOM be.PST.1SG work-PROG shop-LOC.SG when go-PRF.PST.3SG rain.NOM.SG
Translation: I was working in the shop when it started to rain

Primary_Text: еле кэ̄джев тэ ке̄ пӯдӭ е̄бпшэнҍ тонн це̄ӆьк штэ Нестер пӯдӭ
Analyzed: jelʲe keːʥ-aw tə kʲeː puːdʲ-e  jiːbːʃ-ənʲ tonː ʦʲeːl̥ʲkʲ ʃtə nʲesʲtʲer puːdʲ-e
Gloss: if ask‑PRS.3PL PTCL who.NOM.SG come‑PST.3SG horse‑COM.SG 2SG.NOM say.IMP.SG that Nester.NOM.SG come‑PST.3SG
Translation: If somebody will ask you who has come with the horse, you tell them that it’s Nester who has come with the horse
The diable will eat you anyway
He’s going to write {but in the meantime, he's gone to get a pen and paper}

Primary_Text: kues's' mɨjj ruekxem m'iinn aǯ' l'aajj ujjtma
Analyzed: kuəsʲː mɨjː ruəkx-əm mʲiːnː aʥ lʲaːjː ujːt-ma
Translation: When we woke up, our father had already left

Primary_Text: кē адтҍ гэс цōвнэч пэ Тӣрьмесь кāллса, цōвнченҍ пэ тēррмас, анҍ сōнн чāррк
Analyzed: kʲeː adʲː gəs ʦoːwn-əʧ pə tʲiːrʲmʲesʲ kaːɫːs-a ʦoːwn-ʧ-enʲ pə tʲerːmas anʲ soːnː ʧaːrːk
Gloss: who.NOM.SG now PTCL wake.up-COND.3PL PTCL Thunder old.man-DIM.ACC.SG wake.up-COND-3PL PTCL thunder.ACC.SG let 3SG.NOM thunder.PRS.3SG
Translation: If only someone would wake up Tirmes, Grandfather Thunder, and let him thunder

Primary_Text: ja monn n'učsi̮лčɛ v'eлos'ip'et ɛл ja jodi̮nč'e
Analyzed: ja munː ɲuʧ-s-əɫː-ʧ-e vʲeɫosʲipʲet əːɫ ja jod-ən-ʧ-e
Gloss: and 1SG.NOM jump.on-MOM-PFV-1SG bicycle.GEN.SG on and go-PUNCT-COND-1SG
Translation: I would jump on my bike and ride
If you had wings, you would fly away

Primary_Text: te'll nū'tt pi̮jet vē̮ǹˌse i suggev ku'le-še'lle mudda sajja
Analyzed: təlʲː nuːtʲ pɨj-et wəːnːs-ə i sugː-əw kulʲlʲe-ʃɨlʲlʲ-e mudːa sajː-a
Gloss: then seine.ACC.SG put-PRS.IPS boat-DAT.SG and row-PRS.3PL fish-catch-INF other place-DAT.SG
Translation: Then the seine is put into the boat and one rows to fish in another place

Primary_Text: mokka-mokka sugax tɛs't˙ i udлi̮n'n'e poppɛlt
Analyzed: mogːamogːa sug-ax təsʲtʲ əjː udɫəɲːe pɒːbːəɫt
Gloss: in.zigzags row-PRS.2SG then NEG.3SG quickly hit.CNG
Translation: When one swims in zigzags, it's hard to hit

Analyzed: sʲiːn-ətʲ pugː goːnː-əʃ ʃɨlʲː-e pajː jɒːwʲrʲ-etʲ
Translation: They were all driven to fish in the upper lakes
Example_Source: Archive of the KarSC RAS, fund 1 inventory 5 file 204

Translation: It was cold in the huts

Primary_Text: puarsamus al'l'k’ l'ai čeh'p' sirrɛ garmon'an˙
Analyzed: puarːs-amusː alʲːkʲ lʲaːjː ʧeːhʲpʲ sʲiːrː-ə garmonʲa-nʲ
Gloss: old-SUP son.NOM.SG be.PST.3SG master.NOM.SG play-INF accordion-COM.SG
Translation: The eldest son was a master of playing the accordion

Primary_Text: no da tanna Katrin˙ tone l'anč
Analyzed: no da tanːa katrinʲ ton-ə lʲaːɲʧ
Translation: And then Katrin will be your

Analyzed: waːjwaʃ oːɫːm-əsʲtʲ lʲiːjː-enʲ koːɫːm alʲkʲ ja nʲiːjːt
Gloss: poor man-LOC.SG be-PST.3PL three son.GEN.SG and daughter.NOM.SG
Translation: The poor man had three sons and a daughter
Example_Source: Archive of the KarSC RAS, fund 1 inventory 5 file 204

Translation: The skin was removed and dried

Primary_Text: cōнн воāнҍцэ, воāнҍцэ, я рыбп гӯ лōӈӈнэв, я пӯдзэ пырр сōн каррэв
Analyzed: soːnː wɒːnʲʦʲ-e wɒːnʲʦʲ-e ja rɨpː kuː ɫoːŋːn-əw ja puːʣ-ə pɨrː soːn karː-əw
Gloss: 3SS.NOM go‑PST.3SG go‑PST.3SG and partridge.NOM.PL how take_off-PRS.3PL and reindeer‑NOM.PL around 3Sg.GEN run‑PRS.3PL
Translation: She had been on her way for a while, and then partridges  fluttered, her reindeer started running

Primary_Text: вуая вуэӈханна сӯгкэ вэ̄ннсэнҍ раст Луявьр
Analyzed: wuaj-a wuəŋ-xanːa suːgː-ə wəːnːs-ənʲ rast ɫujaːwʲrʲ
Gloss: can-PRS.1SG rest-ABE.PTCP row-INF boat-COM.SG across Lovozero
Translation: I can row a boat across Lovozero without resting
These Kildin Sami were brought to Chudz'javv'r
Example_Source: Archive of the KarSC RAS, fund 1 inventory 5 file 204

Translation: This old woman who ate this moon became ill

Primary_Text: cōнн сāрнэ ныдтҍ са кулсэм райя ёррэм мӯр кыдцрэмуж.
Analyzed: soːnː saːrn-ə nɨdʲː sa kuɫ-s-əm rajja jorr-əm muːr kɨʦːr-əmuʒ
Gloss: 3SG.NOM speek-PST.3SG so until hear-PTCP until fall-PTCP tree.GEN.SG crunch-NMLZ.ACC.SG
Translation: He repeated this until he heard the sound of a falling tree
a cigar which had been smoked down to half of its size
The battle axes have been sharpened.

Primary_Text: нӣйтэнч ōнӭ тэнн ēммьнесьт кулханна нэ̄м
Analyzed: nʲiːjt-əɲʧ oːnʲ-e tənː jeːmʲːɲe-sʲtʲ kuɫ-xanːa nəːm
Gloss: girl-DIM.NOM.SG bear-PST.3SG this.GEN.SG land-LOC.SG hear-V.ABE name.ACC.SG
Translation: The girl had a name unheard of in this land

Analyzed: mʲiːn koːpːʧ-em baːlʲ muːrʲj-etʲ nʲiːjt ɫɒːwːɫ-ənʲ
Translation: While we were picking berries, the girls were singing
The players are divided into two teams

Primary_Text: оа̄һка выльшэдтҍ мун э̄л я сēннтма соа̄ррн
Analyzed: ɒːhk-a vɨlʲʃedʲː mun əːɫ ja sʲeːnːt-ma sɒːrːn
Gloss: grandmother.DIM.NOM.SG look.PST.3SG 1SG.GEN on and be.angry-PTCP.PST say.PRS.3SG
Translation: Grandma looked at me and said angrily
The girls sang when picking berries
The old man rides the most beautiful reindeer

Primary_Text: ēнамусса шоабашт Ёак пуэдтлэ рōдҍхэлетҍ лыһк сайе
Analyzed: jeːna-musːa ʃɒbaʃt jɒk puədː-ɫ-ə roːdʲxəlʲ-etʲ ɫɨhk sajj-e
Gloss: a.lot-SUP love.PRS.3SG Joak.NOM.SG come-FRQ-INF parent-DAT.PL work place-DAT.SG
Translation: Most of all, Yasha loves to be at his parents’ work
He will take me with him
I arrived at the school in Lovozero
The bear climbed up in the pine tree
And he walks from village to village
She came into the yard with her reindeer
And they took her on the sledge to the place where  the boat was
It can't be cut with an axe right away
I became a member of the Comsomol

Primary_Text: пугк я̄бпаш, ке̄йт со̄нн куэссь-ля̄ннч уййнэль, ӣлленҍ лӣффенҍ
Analyzed: pugː jaːbːaʃ kʲeːjt soːnː kuəsː-lʲaːɲːʧ ujːn-əlʲ jiːlʲː-enʲ lʲiːfʲː-enʲ
Gloss: all horse who.ACC.PL 3SG.NOM when-INDF see-FRQ.PST.3SG live-PST.3PL barn-LOC.PL
Translation: All the horses she had ever seen lived in barns
The books the girl put down fell down
